Department of Special Collections and University Archives

Stanford, California

did.head: Descriptive Summary
did.unittitle: Barry Whitehead collection of horse prints: Breeder and Sportsman Horseman Magazine,

physdesc.label: Extent
physdesc.extent: 2.5 linear ft. (23 prints; 67 magazine covers or parts)

repository.label: Repository
repository.corpname: Stanford University. Libraries. Dept. of Special Collections and University Archives.

userestrict.head: Publication Rights
userestrict.p: Property rights reside with the repository. Literary rights reside with the creators of the documents or their heirs. To obtain permission to publish or reproduce, please contact the Public Services Librarian of the Dept. of Special Collections.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation:
prefercite.p: [Identification of item] Barry Whitehead collection of horse prints: Breeder and Sportsman Horseman Magazine, M0783, Dept. of Special Collections, Stanford University Libraries, Stanford, Calif.

did.unittitle: "Harold," by Henry Stull. 27 x 37 cm. PlateVI, with full page genealogy and description. 1880
"Sainfoin," engraving by C.R. Stock, painting by Harington Bird, A.R.C.A. 41 x 51 cm. 1890
"Ayesbury Grand Steeple Chase; the Start, February 9, 1866," C. Bentley, Sculp; Wm Alken, Del 34 x 49 cm.
"Breeder and Sportsman," San Francisco. Includes Britton & Rey lithograph and drawings by E. Wyttenbach. 1889, Sept 14
"Hindoo," by Henry Stull, 27 x 38 cm. Short text on mat. 1881
"Luke Blackburn," by Henry Stull. 27 x 38 cm. Plate VII, with full page genealogy and description. Also, full page genealogy and description for "Iroquois," but no picture. 1881
"Maud S.," by Maurice S. Scanlon. 28 x 37 cm. With caption. 1880
"Parole," by Harry Hall, Newmarket. 28 x 38 cm. Plate III, with full page genealogy and description. 1879
"Hindoo," same plate and description as #1. Better condition.
"Anvil," drawn and engraved by George Townly Stubbs, London. 21 x 26 cm. 1794
"Dexter." drawn by J. Cameron; lithograph by Currier & Ives, New York. 27 x 38 cm. 1871
"Iroquois," by Henry Stull. 27 x 38 cm. (description in box 2, folder 2, for conservation work) 1881
"Moses," drawn and engraved by James Pollard, London. 38 x 48 cm. 1822
"Leamington," Armstrong & Co., Boston, copyright S.F. Cassino. 28 x 38 cm. 1881
"Bonnie Scotland," Armstrong & Co., Boston, copyright S.F. Cassino. 28 x 38 cm. 1881
"Aylesbury Grand Steeple Chase; Coming In, February 9, 1866," C. Bentley, Sculp.; W. Alken, Del., London. 33 x 48 cm.
"Favonius," engraved by E.G. Hester; painted by Harry Hall. 45 x 50 cm.
"Billy Barton," painted and engraved by F.B. Voss, copyright at the Sign of the Gosden Head, New York. Plate 3. 34 x 37 cm. 1834
"Industry," engraved by C. and G. Hunt, painted by J.F. Herring, and published by John Moore, London. 40 x 48 cm.
"Childers; the fleetest horse that ever run at Newmarket," Houston fecit; Seymour delint; published March. Hand colored. 30 x 35 cm. 1755
"The Portraiture of Lamprey," Houston fecit, Seymour delint. Hand colored. 30 x 35 cm. 1755, Mar
"Ormonde," Manchester, John Harrup. 59 x 75 cm. [c.1886]
"Galopin," [Manchester, John Harrup.] 59 x 75 cm. [c.1875]
"The Celebrated Trotting Mare Lucy, Passing the Judges Stand," New York, Currier & Ives. 49 x 69 cm. [c.1872]
